title: 115_s2508
content: The "Northern Border Regional Commission Reauthorization Act of 2018" amends administrative expenses of regional commissions and grants for economic and infrastructure development. The "Northern Border Regional Commission Reauthorization Act of 2018" includes amendments to economic and infrastructure development grants, focusing on growing successful community economic development capacity in regions and attracting businesses from outside the United States. Additionally, a State Capacity Building Grant Program is established. The "Northern Border Regional Commission Reauthorization Act of 2018" establishes a State capacity building grant program to provide grants to Commission States for economic and infrastructure development. The program aims to support the efforts of eligible counties in Maine, New Hampshire, New York, and Vermont. The program aims to support Commission States in business retention, job creation, workforce development, economic and infrastructure planning, broadband access, infrastructure investments, local economic development effectiveness, and innovative economic practices to compete globally. Grants under the program may be used for various purposes. Funds from a grant under the program can support projects, programs, or expenses in eligible counties. However, they cannot be used for purchasing furniture, fixtures, equipment, or compensating certain state members of the Commission. Each Commission State must submit an annual work plan detailing the proposed use of the grant before receiving funding. The grant amount is determined based on the state's share of administrative expenses of the Commission for the fiscal year. Grants are only provided after the Commission approves the state's annual work plan. The program must be approved as part of the annual budget of the Commission. Grant funds are only available for the fiscal year they are provided. Each Commission State must submit a report annually on the use of grant funds. The Commission may appropriate necessary funds, not exceeding $5,000,000 per fiscal year, to carry out the program. These funds should supplement, not supplant, other Commission activities. The Commission may appropriate necessary funds, not exceeding $5,000,000 per fiscal year, to carry out the program and other activities. SEC. 5. Amendments to the Northern Border Regional Commission include adding counties like Belknap, Carroll, Cheshire, Coos, Addison, Bennington, Chittenden, Essex, Orange, Orleans, Rutland, Washington, Windham, and Windsor. SEC. 6. Authorization of appropriations extended to 2023. SEC. 7. Technical amendments made. Chapters 1, 2, 3, and 4 of title 40, United States Code, are renamed as chapters 151, 153, 155, and 157.
